Classes | Functions

Ground relations

Classes

class  GRelation
 Class representing a ground relation.This class provides a way to represent a relation along with operations on it. In all the documentation of this class this refers to the represented relation. There are two basic notions attached to a relation:

  • Its arity that is the number of elements that each tuple in the relation has.
  • Its cardinality, which is the total number of tuple the relation contains.
More...

Functions

GRelation create (const std::vector< Tuple > &dom)
 Creates a relation with the elements contained in dom.The arity of the created relation corresponds to the number of elements of the provided tuples. All the tuples are assumed to be of the same arity.
GRelation create_full (int a)
 Creates a full relation of arity a.
GRelation read (std::istream &is, int arity)
 Creates a relation of arity arity from the contents read from is.The expected format in is is:

  • Different tuples are sepparated by end of line (std::endl)
  • Elements in each tuple are separated by one or more spaces
  • Tuples are of exactly arity elements.

std::ostream & operator<< (std::ostream &os, const GRelation &r)
 Outputs relation r to os.

Detailed Description

Ground relations are the basic construct of the relation domain. The term ground is used to differenciate this relation from a relation represented by a decission variable. This module offers the capability to define and operate on this kind of relations.

GRelation read ( std::istream &  is,
int  arity 
)

Creates a relation of arity arity from the contents read from is.The expected format in is is:

  • Different tuples are sepparated by end of line (std::endl)
  • Elements in each tuple are separated by one or more spaces
  • Tuples are of exactly arity elements.

Warning:
An exception InvalidRelationSource is thrown if the stream is either empty or failed.
